You try to get her attention
Before you decide, she approaches and sweeps the mess you were on
11521221.content:
You stopped eating upon hearing something from outside the kitchen. It sounded like footsteps that were followed by a series of clickings. These clicks sound like the ones that came from a pair of high-heels. You know what that means; it means a giant is coming! You didn't even have the chance to go and hide because the giant already walk into the kitchen.

The giant was in fact a long blonde haired woman in her 30s. She wears a yellow sleeveless blouse, a gold necklace, a long red skirt, and a pair of black high-heels. At first glance, she looks pretty normal until you noticed something strange about her skin color; it was blue-colored. She also has two antennas on her head and a long tail behind her. You were very surprised to see a inhabitant of this world that looks nothing like the ones from your world as if you were in another planet.

As the giant woman walks into the kitchen, you saw that she's holding something in her hands and realized what she's here for. The object she was holding was a giant futuristic broom and it's a sign that she's going to clean the kitchen.

The giantess set the broom to the ground and begins to sweeping the floor while humming to herself. You see that the broom she's using not only looks advanced but also works like it too. While she sweeps, you can see tons of crumbs stick themselves into the small bristles like magnets; it seems to be part broom and part vacuum as you can hear a sight sound coming from it.

You stood and start to think about what to do next. You could simply try to go to the door to escape or you could try to get this giant lady's attention. By the looks of it, she might be kind enough to help you out but unfortunately, you'll might get in the way of being swept away plus you don't look big enough to get noticed right away.

You better hurry up because it looks like she's going for your exact spot.
11521221.title: Maria Appears

choices: She decided to get rid of it
She gets an even closer look
115212213.content:
Unfortunately, you didn't have time to think about what to do when you see the giantess is now coming in close which gives you very little time to get away. You look up at the towering lady that is now standing above you and you realized both that you were so tiny and she's so huge that you can barely see her face. Her humming echos from above like a storm and around your location; it wasn't too loud but it did enough to cover your ears. You watch as the woman lower her broom towards you and starts to sweep up the crumbs. You managed to make a quick leap to get out of the way just as the broom almost hit you. You did it again just as she sweeps again and once again as the whole progress continues.

---------------------------------------------------

Maria hums to herself as she continues to sweep the mess of crumbs; it was so that she can reduce the stress of cleaning the whole house because her family just doesn't care about cleaning after themselves. While she loves them very much, she sometimes wonders if they can ever learn about responsibility. She sighed and decide to start telling her middle daughter Libby to stop leaving so many crumbs and bits of food around the kitchen because it'll attract some bugs around here.

While she sweeps the floor, she suddenly could have sworn there was something moving on the floor causing her to stop cleaning. She bent down a little bit to get a close look at what it is.

While she couldn't see what it really look, she sees what looks to be a little speck on the floor. She shook her head and frowned; great, looks like a tiny insect has already made it here.

What does Maria do to the "insect"?
115212213.title: Swept Away

11521222.content:
You were so focused on eating the crumbs that you didn't noticed that someone was coming into the kitchen. It took about a few rhythmic sounds to finally stop eating and pay attention. They sound just like footsteps and you know what means; a giant inhabitant of this house is coming. A moment later, you see a shadow from outside the kitchen and finally comes in the giant person.

The giant looks alot like a young girl about 12 years old with short blonde hair that was tied up by a ponytail. She wears a green T-shirt with a yellow star on it, a brown skirt, and a pair of black boots. You first thought she looks normal (aside the fact that she is alot bigger than you) until you see what looks like two antennas on her head and a tail from behind her. Her skin wasn't any color you see from people in your own world because it was colored blue. "This can't be real..." you mutter to yourself in disbelief. Is this some kind of alien or something? Are you in a world of giant aliens?

You stop questioning yourself when the giant girl makes her way to your current spot, did she saw you? Not quite. Instead of looking at you, she was looking at the cookie box that was on the shelf above you. As she approaches, you slowly see only half of her body until the only thing you see was her giant black boots.

You can hear her picking up the cookie box and begins snacking. During this time, the only sound you hear were rather loud munching coming from the girl as she eats the cookies. Thankfully, it wasn't loud enough to hurt your ears. Unfortunately, you are in the middle of a crumb storm that was caused by her messy eating and they are falling towards you.

Making no hesitation, you make a quick dash under the cupboards; next to the air vent where you come from. You watch the giant crumbs come down like an avalanche in front of you. You thought about trying to get this giant blue-skinned girl's attention. She may be young, but she does look somewhat old enough to understand your situation at hand. Unfortunately, the crumbs still continue to fall down which makes it pretty risky so you can just wait here until she's done.

Of course, you can just sneak into the backdoor and escape. That was your plan, wasn't it?
11521222.title: Crumbling Down

choices: A giant woman in a bikini (Maria going outside to sunbathe)
A giant girl with a ball in her hand (Katie going to play soccer outside)
A giant man with some tools (Zak going to work outside)
11521223.content:
After filling up your tummy with these crumbs, you make your way to the glass door that is far on the kitchen wall. This took you about a few minutes to get there but thankfully, no one was here at the moment when you got there. Since you are standing near the door, you could finally see the outside world and boy, you were in a huge surprise when you saw what it looks like.

The place looks like a gigantic backyard, but that's only the beginning of how strange it is. The world beyond is incredibly futuristic as you saw the nearby houses that were hugely advanced. The yard itself was bizarre as the grass is blue instead of green and there is a strange tree in the corner that is filled with odd flowers. The fences and other familiar objects are also futuristic and up above, you saw a UFO-like craft passing by. You finally realized that you are in some kind of alien planet.

"No wonder why everything is so big..." You said to yourself.

Another thing you realized, is that there's no way to get pass the door. There's no gap to crawl underneath or anything at all; this glass is too advanced to have something like this. You look up to your left and saw a button that may be the one to open the door. Unfortunately, it's way too high to reach it and you doubt that you can even make it up there. You have no other choice but to sit there and wait for someone to come here.

Luckily for you, there is a sound coming from outside the kitchen. This means that someone is coming here and hopefully to go outside. You look behind and saw a giant making their way here.

Who is it?
11521223.title: The Alien World Ahead

1153.content:
World 7

This world takes place in an ancient tribal village that is quite primitive, but has at least a few things related to a typical sociality such as wearing clothes (in a primitive way which only covered their um...privates), families, and even having leaders managing their villages. They often go out and hunt for foods in the wild with weapons common in their time such as large spears. Better not get in their way though...

World 8

This one loosely takes place in a medieval, fairy-tale-like land with many kinds of people and/or creatures that you mostly find in this type of setting including knights, castles, elves, goblins, and so on. This place can be dangerous as it's filled with many kinds of mythical creatures that could be pose a threat to your tiny size even the most smallest creatures such as fairies towered over you like skyscrapers. You especially want to avoid getting contact with larger monsters as a single stomp could be your last!
1153.title: Any other worlds?

choices: ...got interrupted when a loud booming sound is heard far behind you
11531.content:
You don't know how long you were knocked out after that crazy event with that large, colorful sphere. After all that extra five minutes, you finally got up and rubbed your eyes. "Alright, what the hell is going on here?" you said to yourself as you look around and saw nothing but long, towering plants that made you feel like you were in a middle of a jungle. Upon closer inspections, they look more like long blades of grass. "Hmmm...weird" you said as you were about to take your first step, but suddenly you heard a loud cracking sound that sounded like something walking on a pile of leaves. When you were about to see what it is, you saw a large creature crawling amongst the tall grass. Your heart sink when you realize what it was: a humongous millipede crawling towards your path. You quickly leaped into a pile of large grasses behind you as the large, monstrous anthropoid moved past you.

"Oh my god, that was HUGE!!!" you said, now nervous on where you are right now. You decided to climbed one of the tall grass and get a better look at where you are right now. You climbed up with all your might and soon, you reached the top. You looked around, trying to see where are you right now.

Looking around, you finally discovered that you are in a middle of large open field that stretched for miles. You were amazed of your current location to see how everything looked incredibly huge but that wasn't the only thing you saw, however. Just several miles away, you saw what looked like structures. These buildings appeared to look like huts and they're tons of these which formed a large village of some sort. "Oh my god! Something tells me that they are giants in this world too." you said. You couldn't help but feel like nothing more than an insect in this world than a human being. Your mind became curious and decided to check out the ancient village of giants, but you don't want to risk more danger especially since they're over a thousand times bigger than that terrifying millipede from earlier.

After a long thought, you...
11531.title: Anicent Giants

choices: ...only for a giant villager to arrive.
115311.content:
Against your better judgment, you ultimately moved forward, eager to check out this gigantic village. Fortunately for you, no one seemed to be around right now, so there was no risk of being stepped on by an unaware member of the tribe. You couldn’t help but wonder if they were off somewhere...maybe warring with another tribe, or hunting for food?

Unable to fight your curiosity, you entered one of the monolithic huts. You could notice a few spears on the ground nearby - with stone tips to really let enemies have it. What appeared to be logs and stones sat in the center of the hut; you figured this was how they created fire in ancient times.

Quickly growing bored of this hut, you exited into the afternoon sun once again...
115311.title: Exploring the Giant Hut

choices: She examines this curious mite-sized thing
115313.content:
B-BOOM

A loud, cacophonous crash echoed from behind, across the acres of immense trees, shaking the surrounding grass stalks around your 2 millimeter tall body. The skies darkened, falling into shadows. It was like a great clap of thunder.

KA-BOOM

Actually, it was a great clap of thunder. Black clouds swept over the jungle. Watery pellets descended around you, drumming steadily. One raindrop hit your cranium, sending a cool sting through it.

The storm's rhythm quickened. As if your perspective wasn't dizzying enough, the sounds from every direction made it hard to orient yourself. You ran forward, looking for a safe spot. New rivers and oceans formed, spreading out in elaborate shapes through the cracked soil - doubtlessly only puddles compared to the grass. A fine mist formed around the environs, further impeding your visibility.

With the ground dampening more every second, you moved from dashing to wading to practically swimming through murky water.

More raindrops crashed against your back. The constant torrent made the wet impacts feel like a flurry of punches. It drove you harshly into the mud, but didn't stop. The mud had a firm grasp of your arms and legs. Trembling surrounded you. It was hard to tell how much was from the downpour, and how much was your head ringing.

...No, it was something else shaking the earth.

A crash of thunder lit up a leviathan-sized body miles away. It scurried forward briskly. A pair of strongly-defined legs creating great splashes as the shape trod. across the murky plane. A human! And one with a downright feminine silhouette. One of the giant inhabitants of this new (yet ancient) world? Though, the snarling coming from the figure's direction seemed closer to a wild beast's cry, shaking through the voluminous leaves... And oddly, she dashed in the opposite direction from the village. You tore yourself from the muck, keeping your eyes pointed to the clouds from which you saw the colossal woman.

Another bright crash, and the figure appeared again. Its distance from you could no longer be described in miles. Micrometers would be a more accurate unit of measurement. A titanic, mud-coated sole slammed down on you. The foot fully engulfed your ground-bound body. In fact, it was immense enough to cover twenty more bodies at your size.

Immediately, the skin compressed you tightly within the brownish prison. Its map of intricate folds and creases brushed against your body. The constant shifting indicated that this humongous foot's even-more-monolithic owner was still rushing forward. This titan's heel rose, lifting you with it. Your dirty body had joined the minuscule twigs and tiny pebbles caught tight in the wet layer of grime coating the sole. In front, the toes dug into the soil, and pushed back, propelling the limb forward. Strong winds blew past you, and you saw tiny clumps of soil falling unevenly from your surroundings. Before you knew it, the tribal woman completed her step.

SQUELCH

A flood of mud erupted up through the supple soil's trembling. Had you been any larger, or the ground any dryer, the incredible force springing from the giantess' firm legs would've squeezed your body flat. But the ground was accommodating, softly pushed back around your tiny face. You spat out some gross brown stuff that entered your mouth.

BOOM

Her foot was accommodating, too: one teeny wrinkle held around you. The harsh step pressed you in deeper to the patterns across her skin, and covered you with more mud. A thunderclap rung out above, which she responded to with a grunt. You barely registered another ferocious, desperate step in the distance before...

SPLAT

The sole hit the ground again, shaking you with dizzying force. The horror was so intense, so numbing, that you barely felt connected with the treacherous scene. Your mind remained frozen in a Blue Screen of Death - until another sickening noise rebooted reality.

SLAM

Your body, comparatively, felt more liquid than solid: drenched, cold, and in the very center of every impact.

THUD

The dirt that didn't flutter down got squeezed tighter and tighter into her heel, forming an inescapable clump of mixed grime and filth. From your perspective, the mud caught across her toes could each form their own landmass.

SMUSH

In a precious second, you glimpsed a fresh trail of clean footprints behind: one of them your body was just peeled away from. From their shape, her toes were fairly proportionate; and both the hell and ball of her foot were very round and full. Judging from the depth, she had a low arch - which pressed against the ground with the rest of the extremity.

SQUISH

Each time the ground shook from her sprint, you could move yourself a little. You twisted your tiny arm right...

SMOOSH

An earthy smell filled your nostrils, mixed with a salty taste in your mouth. You twisted a little more, torso now pressed against your unaware ride's gigantic heel.

SQUEEZE

You still heard the rain and thunder, but the sound of her footsteps deafened them. Her foot curled up slightly when it lifted, the detritus caressing and molding your form. When this stride ended, flattening you again with a -

POUND

- the pressure pushed your face right into the whorls. A bit of skin nuzzled across your lips. When you attempted to spit, it only got more of the foot flesh pushed against your little tongue.

THWOOOM

Unable to see anything before you or behind you, you were left feeling the rushed bounds of this stranger's leg muscles. Her shivers from the cloudburst were shockingly close and real - compared to the distant sound of raindrops, and the animal noises that had fully left your hearing range. All this, without even having seen a clear view of her.

STOMPSTOMP

Was this a punishment for past sins? You sunk deeper in, feeling crumb-like bits rattling down your back.

STOMPSTOMP

She was getting faster. You felt the force of her breaths - coming in shallow gasps - despite being so far away from her. This was a particularly wet area, as she sprinted through a puddle. You held your breath to avoid drowning, and kept it until the next series of crushing assaults.

STOMPSTOMPSTOMP

After a moment, her foot lay flat on the ground, ankle flexing. A small rattling shot through your ears. Dirt from the ground and her sole squeezed through every bit of your clothes. The runner's heel pushed out. She nimbly leaped over a roadblock, then pushed out both feet open ahead of her to catch the impact.

CRASH

Forget joining the dirt clumps. If it kept squeezing you this mercilessly, you might end up becoming a permanent tattoo on the woman's sole. You yelled out for any form of attention, or mercy, from this sky-scraping sprinter.

STOMPSTOMPSTOMP

Your limbs now cried out in protest as the sole squeezed around them. Even if anyone else was out in this wilderness in the middle of the thunderstorm, they'd be hard-pressed to spot you plastered across the foot. The woman made a 90 degree turn on her heel - the one with you right in the center.

TWIST

In that instant, she pushed the entire unbearable mass of her mega-scale body across your speck-scale frame. The world spun around you twice. Gravity, time, and distance lost meaning. Murky soil erupted out in all-encompassing torrents and geysers, as if her skidding dug down to the planet's core. The whole time, she never lost any speed. And as if nothing ever happened, she kept running onwards.

STOMPSTOMPSTOMPSTOMPSTOMP...

She brushed her feet, then stopped. Your mind froze. Was she about to jump agai-

BWUMP.

Something soft to the ground. Slowly, the foot that held you lifted up. And, for once, it didn't descend. The toes kept pointed to the sky... Or rather, the ceiling. It took many breaths for your inhale-exhale tempo to regain its normal speed. The rain no longer hit you, though you could still hear a distant thunderclap. Once breathing normally, you realized: the girl you rode with was sitting in the middle of a cave. Her own heart was racing, too.

But... Why a cave? Wasn't there a village nearby? Had this girl been chasing food... or running away from something?

Trying to dry off, the stranger from the new world rattled her hands and feet twelve times each. Your body rattled up and down, watching hardening mud clumps fly away with the water droplets. She then brushed titanic fingers across her body, as if wiping off a bug. Her index slid over you, with enough strength to finally peel you off her sole. With a satisfying, cool sensation, your head separated from the moist surface, followed by both arms, torso, waist, and legs. You fell a mercifully short distance to the ground, lying on the dirt.

Grabbing two sticks from the ground, the tribal giantess lit a small fire, resting it down. With the warm light, you could see her features more clearly - in fact, this first glance of her face was downright intense. Her sun-tanned face held with red triangular markings. They moved down her body into intricate lines that crossed her limbs, twisting spirals around her strong shoulders and toned stomach, and even a few patterns across her foot soles. All that covered here was two pieces of simple white cloth and a makeshift bracelet, necklace, and anklet.

She shook her head. Her unkempt copper-tinted hair swayed, like a cross between a supermodel's hair wave and a wet dog drying itself. When it swung back, her blue eyes were wide, alert... And they pointed right at you.

Your body remained still, trapped between the glowing flames and the length of her legs.
115313.title: Wet, Muddy Tribal Girl Soles

choices: Bite the bullet; climb under her feet and poke her tats
Let's no get under her, and instead poke her toes
1153131.content:
Everything was still, and beyond the crackle of the fire, quiet. She stared at you, a deep gaze that pierced right through you. You met her eyes, you, a literal speck, a fleck of dirt, daring to meet the challenge of a god.

She broke off first. Her eyes returned to the fire, her hands busy with a stick her used to prod the flames.

You breathed. The flickering light made everything seem more... supernatural. Still, there was nothing natural about this, as you remained still, laying on you back among the field of debris shook off this tribal girl's soles. Perhaps you needed help, but this girl had only minutes ago pounded you into a flat paste. She couldn't be your best source of assistance, could she?

The ground rumbles again, and you see her begin to stir. Flinching, you're helpless as her feet turn over onto their soles, missing you by a hair's breadth. You stumble and stand, ignoring the agony in a fight or flight instinct that is heavily leaning towards flight. She shifts further, and you grunt as her big toe slams into you, sweeping you and and collection of dirt clumps aside as she pulls her knees into her body.

You're a speck of dirt, just inches in front of a giant's toes. Yet, as you look up, gazing at the deep red swirls along her flesh, peering into the blue eyes that cast out towards nothing, spotting the gashes and scars that mark her body, and witnessing the pout of her lips as she sets her chin on her knees, you feel sorry for her. She's filled with sorrow, that much is clear.

Who is she? Why was she running from her village through the rain in the middle of the night? How is it that, out of all the dirt on all the paths she could have taken, you ended up under her?

It was destiny, plain and simple. You needed her help, and she needed yours.

You decided to call her Destiny, at least until you had her real name.


Destiny did not take very good care of her feet, that much was plain to see. While her toe nails were surprisingly short, everything else about what you could see, which wasn't a lot in the dim light of the fire, was rather... disgusting. You expected the mud, since you were a part of it just a moment ago, that wasn't a surprise. However, her toes were in poor condition; the nails were chipped, the whole underside of her foot was one big callous, and her cuticles were torn up like hell. Not to mention the smell, which was only partially covered by the mud and smoke that filled your nose. It was rank, not just from being unwashed, but from a clear amount of effort. Destiny was sweaty, that much was clear, even through the drying rain on her.

Beggars can't be choosers, you thought to yourself, and with a grimace you moved in. The best way to tackle this was to get her attention from down here, as trying to climb her before she moved would be impossible. With that in mind, you stepped in between her two biggest toes, one hand over your nose the whole way. With the other, you reached out and gave the skin between them a little poke.

No response. You did it again, this time with feeling, and again, the hard, calloused skin didn't budge.

A new plan, then. From what you knew of tribal tattoos, which was little to nothing, the tatted skin would be much more tender than other bits of flesh. Unfortunately, there was only one bit of red ink you could reach, and it was under her arch. Heart in your throat, you slid between Destiny's feet, staring up at the mountains of her shins as you crept over to her instep. One wrong move here, and you could be toast.

Or not, considering the treatment you suffered on your way in here. Still, better to err on the side of caution.

Her arch wasn't much better that her toes; if anything, it was worse. She was a bit flat-footed, but a healthy bit of mud from her run caked the raised flesh. There, however, under the center of her foot, cast deep in shadow by her body, was a bright patch of red. You could reach it, easy as pie, just get on your stomach, crawl under the tons of strong, on-edge woman, and hope that your jabs are processed with a curious gaze and not a quick stomp.

Maybe you should try her toes again.
1153131.title: The ball's finally in your court

choices: Destiny thought she saw something entering the cave
11531312.content:
You really didn't need to throw yourself in any more danger than you already were. Sure, the red markings highlighting the bridge-like structure of Destiny's arch were more reachable, and could be a weak point. And at your height, even a flat foot's arch gave you some breathing room. (If that was the right word, when the earthy, salty odor around you made you hold your nose again.)

But if you were under them, you'd be totally hidden in the shadows of her squatted knees and white-clothed hips. Even if she pulled her feet away, you doubted she would be able to spot you. Fear that surged through you the first time her gaze hit you, and it kept you still as the dirt specks around. Now that you resolved this meeting was fate, you wanted her eyes on you again; and to STAY on you.

Besides: after all that running, her soles were probably not only callused, covered with grime, and chillingly dangerous. They were probably sore. She might not appreciate a pathetic crumb of a crumb prodding and pushing at them.

So you took a deep breath, twitching at the rank musk, and journeyed back to the spot in front of her toes.

Navigating around loose twigs and pebbles, you kept alert, ready to dart to safety for twitches from her ankles. Unfortunately for you, the fire-lit behemoth was anything but stable.

Destiny, just as vigilant as you, turned her neck towards any odd noise or flicker across the stony cave walls. The wet, copper hair brushed along her bare shoulders with only the faintest sound. Probably looking for whatever brought her (and you) in this cave. The tribal girl used the stick to stir the crackling flames at the dripping rocks. With each surprised glance and shallow breath, her gigantic legs tensed, ready to spring up.

She balanced her weight forward and back across the forefoot and hindfoot, preparing to lift and then trying to relax. Her phalanges curled, digging trenches across the ground. With some louder echoes from outside the cavern's safety, her left or right leg turned on the heel, pressing both large toes snugly against each other before she returned them. This cautious stirring formed dirt clouds as the hardened skin rubbed across the soil. The dust rose fast enough and wildly enough that they clouded your vision. You found yourself relying on the glimmering light from the fire to guide the way back in front of Destiny.

A testament to your scale: it took this trek, filled with treacherous quakes and near-misses, just to get back before her feet. You got a clearer view of her face now. Her pupils had widened to adjust to the limited light, making the glowing effect stronger. Their lids, though, hung lower, lashes at a slight downwards slope. Sorrow still dressed her.

You eyed your target - or rather, your targets. Each of the massive, worn toes hovered upwards in a wave, exposing their bases to the crackling fire. Even after having brushed off her soles earlier, assorted dirt clumped across the prints, looking like floating islands. With her legs' pressure removed, they cascaded into landslides, boulders of filth raining down with a crinkling noise. A breathy murmur slid from her bare stomach, muffled by the sound of the toes descending again to the indented soil.

Ten squirming obelisks, total. And between them, eight interspaces; you'd already tried tapping one callused web, between her two biggest toes, with no reaction from the giant. Maybe another spot would be softer?

After choosing at random, you inched towards the smallest of Destiny's digits on her right foot. The ground right in front of the print was dug out in an indent from her fidgeting, and soft from the raindrops splashing towards it. At least, you hoped that was rain, and not sweat, that you were wading through to reach a potential sensitive zone.

Her little toe. You held your breath. A rustle of her anklet echoed through the air. A slosh from below as you stepped forward. The jagged nail fell from your field of vision, replaced with layers upon layers of ridges in the skin. Whereas the space between her toes was like a hard, impenetrable wall, the curve at the tip made this different; you couldn't actually reach the skin until part of that tip covered you. Seeing the tanned ceiling, at once like a landscape and a monster, you started to regret the idea. It'd be so easy to be buried in the murk again.

But no - if that orb brought you here, and it let you survive on the treacherous path earlier. Running now would be pointless. You forced an arm forward, wet hand landing on the lowest ridge. Your fingers fit easily in the hard canyon. With no immediate reaction, you brought another hand up, and dug your fingers into the dermis. No use.

Squeezing too hard could be painful. With the two of you alone, and Destiny still in a state of tension and sadness, that'd easily put you on the her bad list.

You tried something else: elbowing the dirty skin. This pushed the tanned, dusty flesh a touch more. With a gulp of moist air, you pushed your whole arm into the toe. It instantly sprung back, the harsh surface almost tossing you pack without as much as a twitch from her flexor muscles.

Next plan: brushing your hands along the little toe quickly, wiggling each finger, trying to tickle her lightly. You succeeded mostly in covering your palms with the fine rubble and droplets accumulated from the catastrophic sprint in the cave.

It was obvious that this foot - a horror in its expansive scale, wear and tear, and downright tear-inducing odor - had lost a good deal of sensitivity. If you had to guess, you'd say Destiny ran across hard terrain often, and rarely wore shoes, if ever. Did anyone else in that hut village?

Come to think of it, what kind of people lived in there? You had the sense that they might not have much in the way of tech; but this girl was the only one of the giant people you'd seen. In fact, you weren't even sure she lived in those huts, seeing how she sprinted away from them. You looked up across her tattoos, trying to read them for information. All the while, you walked to the next toe, crossing the dug-out soil.

A few triangles and lines slid across her legs. Not much hair on her limbs; that meant a reduced chance of lice scurrying down to meet you. Considering the only tools around to shave were rocks and shells, some of which adorned her neck decorations, some of the (relatively) smaller scars could just be from shaving. Others, though, looked more severe.

You pushed into the second-last toe, prodding it with your arm, then your head, then your whole body. No response, even after winding up for a punch. And the foul smell was starting to get to you, so you didn't want to wait too long. Onto the next.

Her stomach had the largest of the spiraling, red marks. It centered right above her navel, and broke off into smaller loops just around her ribs - some in lines, giving her hips greater definition. Destiny slid an arm across the swirls, pressing it on her simple clothes. Below the white, intertwining ropes that made her top - beginning to discolour from sweat and loosen from stretching - a portion of her bosom was exposed. She pulled the hand away. Fresh, precise gashes ran across the left breast's underside, a glisten across them.

It looked painful. Would she be okay?

A light glare flashed from her mighty teeth, lighting up a small portion of the face. The strings of copper hair were still mostly in shadows. She was wincing, holding her necklace up. Her fingernails, just as chipped as her toenails, tore away a leaf from the assorted objects across it. The girl took a bite into it, chewing for a few seconds. It was just a tad worrying thinking about the force in those molars. Soon, she spat the ground herb into her palm, and rubbed it across the cuts.

You couldn't help but share her pain as she groaned, patting the remedy in. A string of worried thoughts went across your head. Were these tattoos common among the villagers? You'd heard stories of criminals getting permanent marks sewn as punishment; or of having themselves willingly marked to show loyalty or occupation. Come to think of it, there was nothing that actually said the village was inhabited. What if the others were running away, too?

All this speculation, however, wasn't bringing her any closer to noticing you. She returned her gaze to the fire, prodding it more quickly. You picked up the largest pebble you could, buckling under its weight, and tossed it towards a part of the middle toe that looked less dirt-worn. It flicked slightly when the stone hit. The force from her toe sent you back, rolling in the mud. From her empty gaze, it seemed like Destiny's action was subconscious.

Something crossed your mind: if she didn't notice pressure, what about wetness or temperature changes? Like if something slimy touched her foot... You stretched your tongue out, feeling the godlike tribal girl's bodily warmth enter your throat...

No. No. You weren't desperate enough to start foot-licking. It was unhygienic. Just tasting the unwashed sole might be enough to get you poisoned with gigantic germs. Instead, you spat on your hand, rubbing the saliva across the toe. Even this made your stomach turn. Each breath was more and more dreadful, being bathed in this miasma for so long. Your head pounded from the constant noise of her breaths and pulse.

Suddenly, shaking. Her chin slid back. One arm fell to the ground, putting away the stick. The knee lifted. The ball of her foot lifted off the ground, some of the salty water glistening in the fire.

The wetness around you meant you were pulled up a little as Destiny shifted positions. Your arms were glued to the dirty toe again, coming off the ground...

Not that again - you jumped off as soon as possible. The mud made for a soft landing, but it still knocked your wind out. And the muck splashing around you made it hard to move. For the moment, you could only look up and hope she saw you...
11531312.title: Trying Destiny's Toes

choices: Try and help scare the wolves off
Use this chance to get away
1153132.content:
"Hrung... Kio estas?"

A low growl emerged from above, with booming words in a language you didn't understand. Chills shook down your wet spine, dripping with rainwater. She spotted you!

The immense woman's red-tattooed fingertips poked the underside of her lip, curled into an expression of confusion. Above, her untrimmed eyelashes stood out, eyes spread in sudden alert. Mile-wide pupils shrunk slowly in the glowing fire, revealing more of the glistening blue irises. These were pupils trained to quickly identify threats and food. Attached to them, her titanic, healthy body was perfectly trained to overcome foes - or catch meals. It was covered only in simple white underwear, and those swirling red markings along her muscles.

You rested in place, still as a rock, trying to read this titan's actions. Her nose curled up in suspicion and curiosity, making the red paint across it flex with her. The shadows metamorphosed her overpowering form into something even more fearsome, creeping back and forth along her skin with her heavy breaths. The crackle of flame echoed behind you, and sent light against her skimpy bra and beaded necklace - which glistened with moisture. Her bosom's expansions and contractions, accented by the glow, were irregular and brief, making the jewelry chatter. Droplets dribbled off her stomach and limbs, glistening brightly in the dim cavern.

Rain kept crashing outside, with animal noises joining it. "Okay. No need to panic. She could be friendly." Trying not to scream, you reached an arm up to the lightly-clothed titan before you.

Soft thumping - the girl's anklet pieces were moving together. Her leg stretched out to greet it, a single toe pushing forward to poke you. This digit drove into your open torso with the strength of a battering ram. It sent you flying in a clean arc through the sky, and, upon your landing, rolling across the grungy cave ground.

"Neh?! La ero - flugis?!"

The nearly-nude behemoth's startled cry echoed against the walls. She stared at the gigantic toe, twitching it in shock, surprised by her own power over you. Her face tilted over to you. This titan quickly hid her foot under her backside, and her gaze darted to the side. It looked as if she was saying, "nope, that wasn't me who tapped you."

You grumbled through the pain, getting back up. "S-seriously..."

Your tone put the gigantic girl at alert again, scrutinizing your movements. The spiraling tattoos on her shoulders flashed. Her towering hand pawed down to the ground, terraforming the dirty cave floor landscape between her digits. She leaned in more, tilting her neck back and forth. You made out some relatively-minuscule raindrops still running down the mounds of her dangling chest. As they dripped, they gathered into huge puddles by your feet. That face hovered over you like a UFO. Even in the dim candlelight, you could see every detail of its intense, puzzled features. Ropes of copper hair swung like a thousand Swords of Damocles above. Her breath was strong enough to blow stone-sized dust off the ground around you.

It made you flinch, stumbling backwards.

With a snap, she drew her mighty arm back, as if something bit it. Her teeth clenched in surprise, each the right size and sharpness to guillotine a whale. "Fibesta!"

"No... I will not bite you." You inched forward, pointing to yourself. "Friend. Good. Not bug. Don't squish anymore."

Not knowing how much your colossal cave-mate could see (or understand), you put on your biggest, friendliest smile. Through your shaking, some of the remaining dirt and sweat fell off your body. You moved your arms in the most open, non-aggressive pose possible.

The blue eyes above you squinted as she clicked her tongue. Experimentally, she sniffed you.

Gigantic gusts pulled at your shirt from above. It was impossible to keep your footing faced with this bone-shattering wind power. But you didn't tumble over like before. Rather, you floated up towards the suction's source. With just a curious whiff, she'd turned the world around you to a shapeless blur, pulling you up, up, up...

Then, everything was black. Black, but you still felt something underneath you...

...Gross.

This giant huntress has sucked you right up into her left nostril! You were encased in a glob of her snot, nose hairs shifting around like unsteady trees. The flesh inside was also wet, from what you could feel. It formed a whole cave of its own, in a way - the "ceiling" was far enough over your head to make it almost roomy. Her breath's constant huff-puff was like a hurricane to your face and scalp; but you kept held in place by the yellow-green gunk.

"Ah! Eeech! Lasu, lasu, lasu!"

You could tell by the voice pounding below that this woman was seriously irritated by her nasal intruder. She itched her nose. First, it was a quick, brisk rub. Then she began clawing at it rapidly. You felt the soft surface of her skin brush and clash against you. With each twitch of her active, fidgety fingers, slimy mounds of nasal flesh kneaded your teensy body. If anything, it pushed you deeper into the putrid mucus!

Huge winds began erupting around you, with horrid shaking all around the squishy microcosm. Your cave-mate had plugged one nostril with a finger, and was attempting to blow you out. With no access to tissues, she had trouble. The snorts and blows sent even greater winds still across your body, making your hair stand on end.

Finally, one snort pulled so hard, it caught you in a flood of mucus. The waves pulled you down through the behemoth girl's soft palate, onto her tongue. Sensing you there, the mouth quickly built up a flood of saliva.

"Oh, no. HELP - "

You started to call out, only to have your own mouth flooded by the wave of spit sweeping the giant huntress' jaw. Your arms thrashed around in the fluid, its thickness making every wave feel slow and heavy.

An earth-shaking "PWEH!" vocalization melted you. A split-second later, the girl spat you out to the cave floor. Your drop was long; but thanks to your body's minimized weight, the landing didn't hurt much. Still, the pool of drool was so deep that you had to paddle to keep from drowning.

"Eck. Fiaaaa!" The titanic tribal girl ran the side of her red-tattooed arm over her tongue a few times. After watching you twist and turn for a moment, cheeks slightly green, she brought a thumb and index down over your flailing form, a pillar on either end - and with surprising gentleness, plucked you out of the pool. You still couldn't respond or run, having too much of her spit caught in your mouth. You lay helplessly as she twisted her heel, trapping your body beneath the shadow of her largest toe. Not this torture again - your heart raced, throat swelling, as dirt rained upon your face...

She pressed a single immense toe down, covering your body and knocking the wind out.

Then, after a second-long squeeze, she peeled it off. You felt your skin glued to hers by the slimy coating for a moment, before falling back to the dirt floor.

And she pushed back on you, dirtying your form once more.

And off.

The tribal girl's unstoppable toe compressed your torso in a rhythm - until you choked out the last of the liquid into the flesh. Her sole sprung back, still mobile as it dug into the ground. Her gaze lay on you. The sharp teeth were still unsteady, frowning, as if the whole situation embarrassed or disgusted her.

"...Th...thanks?" What else, really, could you say to a half-naked girl that had just given you CPR, and who towered over you even on all fours?

She shrugged, the woosh of her dirty copper hair sending a spittle of salty drops on you. "...Nnhn. Ne dankinde." Her attention turned away.

The rainfall splashed louder outside. You heard the same animalistic screech, close enough to shake you. The copper-haired girl shook at it for a moment, too, looking unsure. Was that beast chasing her? Is that why she ran all that distance away from the village?

No, not one beast. The paws of at least three wolves arrived at the cave entrance. Normal animals wouldn't chase prey that far - but here they were, right at the opening.

The girl in the cave roared back to them, her harsh echo conquering the air. She began waving her hands before the fire. It cast a shadow on the far wall that spanned even larger than the real thing. A goliath able to crush mountains under her heel... She took a deep, quivering breath, and let out another uneasy warning scream. You realized her tactic: she was trying to make herself look larger with the flame, and scare the predators off.

The wolves kept approaching, undeterred.

This would be a good time to run away. But to leave the girl there, after she saved your life... Still, what could you even do to help?
1153132.title: Discovered by the Tribal Girl

choices: Destiny has to keep moving with you
11531321.content:
You were ready to bolt for it; these wolves could eat twelve specks like you in one gulp, judging by the scale of their barking muzzles. The towering tribal warrior girl might be too large of a prey for them; but one wrong move from you, and they'd leap at an opportunity to have your little form in their barking muzzles. What could you possibly do against the wild beasts?

...Wild? You looked up to the girl's quaking, open eyes as she fanned the fire. Sparks danced across the wet shine of outspread arms, embracing the red tattoos. Every little wave sent minuscule splashes of rainwater from her trained, agile muscles, evaporating into the crackle of flames and sparks. A few drips crashed onto your scalp.

It didn't make sense; why would wild creatures follow this behemoth hunter all the way here, through harsh weather? She didn't have any food with her. The hands danced in and out of shadows, empty.

Maybe this massive cave was their territory, and they were defending it? But - as the pain still jolting your back recalled - the two of you had a long journey here through the home. If this cave were the wolves' home, they would have been close enough to come in from the rain, before you and your copper-haired carrier plopped to the ground.

Unless... the wolves weren't wild at all? Were they ancestors of hunting dogs, tamed by some early human? Maybe someone that the red-marked goliath was running away from, with you plastered below?

Was that why she fled the village?

"Nrrr... Tschoo!" As the tattooed girl's fierce warning echoed through the walls, it wavered with an uncertain whimper. She pounded the soil once more, revealing the sole of that foot you had become too familiar with: mud coating its calluses and clumping around the short nails, and between the folds of her toe segments. They hid red markings on the foot's underside; you could barely glimpse the edges before she slammed it down to the earth once more, pebbles flying around it.

Far above, through massive clenched teeth, she took in shallow breaths as her eyes darted to you. They gleamed blue with a sense of urgency and disbelief - and kept darting behind her, as a signal. "Iru!" You felt frozen frozen in her mighty gaze; a speck within her blue-moon pupils. An impatient tap of her immense foot knocked you off your feet; before she positioned the largest digit over you. The mass of wrinkles eclipsed the flame, overcoming the entirety of your ground-bound body, and encasing it in the same mud...

The hard, salty surface of her toe flesh above dragged you back across the ground, coating your torso with grime. Soon, the harrowing weight rose from your chest - slamming once more, as a warning to the wolves, and driving a gigantic, wet footprint into the ground beside you.

You rubbed your jostled head in pain, re-orienting yourself from the young woman's sudden swipe. "Urrghh..." Slowly, your eyes focussed on the flame - the grey wolves were nearing, starting to break the standoff from outside. Droplets slithered down her cloth garments, tracing a line down her sky-high legs; barely visible from the lower lighting in this part of the cave. You realized, the titan's tattooed toes had covertly dragged you to safety from the wolves. Despite her panic, despite her animalesque roars, your colossal cave-mate was trying to keep you from their jaws.

You couldn't just leave her there. Even if a single sinew in her flexing toe and twitching finger held more power than you'd ever seen in a living being... the low, hurried breaths from her sad lips felt deeply human. The more you thought back to the crashes of thunder and her curious sniffing, the less she became a force of nature, pushing your helpless body around; she was someone who you'd escaped danger with. No, even bigger than that: in the clash of flames, the flashing red marks' movements had more importance. The warrior was on edge for a reason; she was being chased by animals for a reason; and, you couldn't help but think, you had landed in her path for a reason.

It was destined to happen this way, no matter what path you or her took. You'd end up on the same muddy road with this titan... Destiny.

Until you could learn your copper-haired companion's name, you decided to call her Destiny. It just sounded right.

You stepped forward. To your right, something big rattled up. Destiny's arm had reached over to pull out a stick - and brushed it out over the flames to try to push the wolves back. Her lips quivered, releasing a cautions groan. Quickly, it grew to a bark, as Destiny swung fast - generating a boom above you, and shifting the shadows nearby.

Undeterred, the wolves approached, jaws snapping. A crash of thunder outside emphasized the rough, torn fur.

You stepped forward, your pulse racing, to the behemoth soles as they shifted. Round crimson markings flashed by your face as she stepped back - waving along with the creases on the side of Destiny's foot. Ignoring the pressure that made your legs shake, and the earthy aroma that made your sinuses ache, you patted your hand on the murky surface. A reassuring brush of your palm, on the only part of her you could reach - sinking into the remaining murky residue over her skin. Even if just for moral support, you would stand with Destiny. You shouted to the animals: "Stand back!"

Between a wave of her arm, the gigantic, red-kissed face stared down to you. "...Ero? Nyeh!?" She shook her neck, and pointed the rod behind her, jabbing it. With a glimmer from the flame, she looked to have an incredulous expression, one eyebrow raised and her mouth open slightly.

But then, as the barking outside approached its crescendo, Destiny leaned in closer - the immense shadows on the wall transmogrifying with the shifting mountains - and stretched her hand out. It was dirtied and wet, boulders of murk and miasma between the shivering wrinkles. The whole thing engulfed you in its shadow, reaching you cautiously. Figuring this was some kind of salute, you stretched your hand out with equal hesitation; and let it press to the woman's skin, sinking in. The furrow in her brows receded with the speed and weight of tectonic plates eroding. She shut her eyes and whispered: "Zamakibo."

"You're welcome." You answered, nodding.

Without warning, her fingertips closed around you, pressing you deep into their salty ridges. You were stuck between a red dot mark, and a clump of dirt. She stood to her full height, bringing you up with her in a soaring rush. Even with your heart racing, you remained perfectly still; a feather floating on the winds of Destiny, raised by her will shifting, crackling flames.

She resumed her shouts, facing the approaching wolves with greater vigour: "Bwaargh! Grr... ARGH!" Her gaping mouth was now close enough that projectile spittle doused you, before fizzling out into the fire below. Uncomfortable warmth ran its course through your sinews.

Two canines pawed back. One, in the center, approached closer - barking at you and your tattooed companion. She snapped at her, baring her teeth; and with a sudden jump back, kicked dirt into the flames. The fire seemed to grow wider, her shadow on the wall larger; and her face was lost in the bizarre, morphing shadows.

You could see your own shadow against the wall, clearly. The angle of the flame made you look almost normal-sized - or it would, were it not for the titaness clutching to you. Her own shade occupied a greater surface area than the brown wall. With the way the flames lit it up, you could practically see the drool running down her lips across the mismatched stones, as your shadow moved in closer to her teeth...

Wait.

The wolf shuffled her feet.

You couldn't dare look down: but Destiny's humid breath blew across your flesh from below. Out of the corner of your eye, you caught the glimmer of her sharp teeth, as she lowered you towards them. You didn't flail or squirm, beyond discomforted wobbles: you just let Destiny take command, as her mouth shut...

CHOMP.

With that sickening crunch, the tamed animal receded, tail swishing to the flame. Its two companions followed. Destiny's harsh, hoarse breaths echoed through the cave, rattling everything, until the last paws had left.

You shook, too. The ground was still hard, leathery, and warm.

Forcing your eyes open you held your breath...

And let it go in a sigh of relief, sinking into her palm. She sunk to her thighs, her building-size shoulders loosening, as her other hand checked you for damage.

Destiny had moved you right beside her cheek. The scaled-up shadows made it look like a gigantic monster had swallowed a whole human, scaring the predators away.

But you knew you had no reason to panic. She might have poked you around with ease, buy This behemoth tribal girl had no reason to gulp down something she found on her foot. She knew how to handle herself in this jungle. You needed her...

And by the way her short, dirt-caked nails kept poking you, while her great blue irises and diluted pupils scanned your tiny face, she needed you.

"Destiny," you muttered again.

She raised an eyebrow. "Dess... tih... knee..." Her scratched neck nodded, and her hand rubbed her glistening hair; until she pointed at herself, mouth open slightly. "Destiny? Hhmh."

You nodded. "Yeah." It looked like she was starting to understand.

As the woman slowly fanned the flames, getting back to her seated position, she jabbed the finger at you. Her voice was down to a whisper. "Zamakibo."

With a gasp of air, you repeated, pointing to yourself: "Zah-mah-ki-bo." You guessed that was her name for you.

"Nmm." For the first time that night, Destiny's lips curled up slightly. It was as if, in the middle of a storm, she was able to shut herself away for a while, into a tiny corner.

You just happened to be in that corner with her.
11531321.title: A Game of Shadows

choices: In the middle of a large castle
Next to a tribal village of elves
11532.content:
"AAAAHHHHHHHHHH"

You screamed as you were speeding across the portal after getting sucked inside one of the many spheres. You don't know how long this will take or where does it leads to, but you seemly just hope this will be all over soon. Suddenly, a bright light flashes over you and blacked out.

After what sounded like an hour or so, you soon gain back your conscious and got up from the ground. You slowly opened your eyes and try to find out where you are.
11532.title: Fantasy Land

choices: Tremors start to shake the earth. (A traveler heading towards the village.)
A giant monster! (A bug from the grass)
115322.content:
The world turned into swirl of colors so bright and overwhelming it felt less like light and more like breaking waves of an ocean crashing against your body. You fight with your senses as they try to take in the sights and sensations, but you find it to be a losing battle. Your breath grows short, your mind begins to race, and your heart pounds like thunder. You scream out into this other worldly rainbow sea before it over took you and you passed out. In that time the darkness gave you solace, an escape from the plane of light that had taken you into its grip. You escaped into the void of your very mind the darkness giving you a sense of freedom as your body moved weightlessly through that unending world of light.

You wake with a sharp gasp with the sounds of nature all around you. Your eyes open to a light blue sky with a few soft white clouds slowly drifting through the sky. That strange world of light, had it been nothing, but some kind of dream? What had that room with orbs bee? Just part of that dream as well? You sit up slowly finding yourself in the middle of strange practically alien looking land. You were sat on the side of a massive brown plan with large boulders scattered about going on into the distance in both directions. On each side of the expansive barren land are towering green plants of some kind as tall as trees, but didn't have bark or leaves simply green shafts that towered in the sky.

You can only guess were the hell you were and how exactly you got there. Had the crystal, portals, and world of light all really happened? If so how had they lead you to this strange place. You didn't have long to think about the situation and how you'd gotten into it when.....
115322.title: On the path to the village of elves

choices: Your prayers fall on deaf ears.
1153222.content:
A towering monster burst out of the forest of green plants! The towering beast was black with a hard outer shell with thick hairs poking out off of every inch of it. You take a few steps back from the massive monster each of its six legs held its body up high over your own. As it moved closer you finally released what it was, an ant. Though this ant had to be close to twenty-five feet long and over twelve feet tall!

It didn't seem hostile at least at first as the giant ant stood in front of you its antenna move about as it looked down at you. You keep slowly moving back, but deep down you knew you'd never be able to out run a bug that size. However, it did seem confused for the moment more interested in figuring out what you were. This wouldn't last forever and you had to think fast, but you didn't have any many options. You eventually picked up a large rock feeling the heft in your hand for a moment. What you really wanted was a gun or better yet a tank to help take down this over sized pest, but a rock was all you were going to get.

The ant either figured out what you were or simply had finished trying as it quickly charged forward. You readied yourself unsure how you'd defend yourself from this thing. In a few seconds the ant was upon you it reached down with its mandibles while you could only pray....
1153222.title: Six legs are better then two.

choices: Follow the woman, its your best chance.
Get off the path, bugs are bad enough you don't need to end up stepped on.
11532221.content:
You scream out as the thick mandibles come down to tear you apart. The the ground shook nearly taking you off your feet and distracting the beast from its little meal. The ant looked up just as a massive shadow cast itself over it, yourself, and thousands of feet around you. You hardly had time to look up yourself seeing the bottom of something coming down at you. The massive thing crashed into the ground smashing most of the ant under the side of it leaving you only a few feet from sharing that same fate. The towering thing quickly lifted back off taking most of the ant's crushed body with it only its head came crashing down next to you.

You were scared out of your mind as you looked up to see what it was that had just saved your life and what it was you couldn't believe. You found yourself looking up the long legs of a woman, a woman that had to be close to two miles tall! She simply walked by leaving you watching the living monolith go about her day before vanishing in the distance.

It hadn't really sunk in before, but with the woman's appearance things started to sink in and the world around you started to make a bit of sense. You weren't on some desolate plan, but a simple path and those trees were little more then wild grass on the edges of it. If all that was true it would mean you were little more then a speck to the world around you. You go pale at the thought unsure what to do next. You couldn't even fight off an ant, how would you survive?
11532221.title: One not so small step

115322211.content:
You think things over for a moment and weigh your options. You could go into the grass, but you'd be seen as little more then a meal to the bugs and wildlife that lived within it. You look over the stain left behind by the ant that had once towered over you and could of killed you without breaking a sweat... if an ant could sweat that is. While the woman that killed that bug was even larger and even more dangerous because of her massive size, she was a person. If he could get her or someone else's attention then he'd stand a chance. You can reason with a person, not so much with bugs. So you decide the best thing to do was stay on the road and follow in the titanic footsteps of your unaware savoir.

Hours Later....

You have been walking for most the day. The young morning had now turned into aging afternoon with a lazy sun hanging low in the sky. You had walked miles by now, at least at your size it was miles. You hadn't thought about the fact this path was not on your scale so a day's walk for a giant could end up a week or two for you. It was quickly growing clear you'd never be able to walk anywhere on your own before dying of starvation or dehydration. You need to figure something out and soon or this road would be the end of you.

Several Hours later....

It started to grow dark making it hard to see much of anything. You'd need to stop for the night or end up getting turned around and getting even more lost then you already were. It would seem you'd have to figure out what you were going to do in the morning, but then a growing tremor. It started light and started to grow stronger and faster. You steady yourself as a towering woman came up over the horizon. This time you were actually able to get a good look at one of these giants in the dying light.

She look like a young woman in her twenties with long black hair going down her back. She had on simple clothing just a basic cloth shirt and pants and what looked like leather shoes. It took you a moment to notice one other feature, her ears... they were massive! It didn't take you long to figure out this woman wasn't human, but in fact looked like an elf!?! You would of normally said elf's weren't real, but your day had proven that you had no clue what was and wasn't real.

You soon lost sight of the elf woman's face as she stopped just a few feet away from you. You could hardly see past the woman's knees as she simply stood still for a moment. It seemed she was looking at something. You keep to the edge of the path and away from her massive feet the best you could not wanting to end up like the ant from that morning.

The woman soon placed her pack on the ground before taking a seat in the grass. This was your chance, you could either try to get this woman's attention now or use her pack to catch a ride to where she is going.
115322211.title: The beaten path

choices: You were safe and sound inside the elf girl's bag
1153222112.content:
Perhaps getting the elf's attention is going to have to wait since it'll be impossible to get her attention at this moment and climbing her will take hours. Looking at her bag, you noticed that it takes just a few minutes to climb and crawl inside of it. If you're in that bag, the elf woman could take you along with you and hopefully be taken to a safe place.

You approached the enormous bag and grabbed on to it. Because of your size and how the bag was made out of burlap fabric, you have no difficulty trying to scale it and quickly, you attempt to reach the top. Looking high up, you see the giantess still resting. "I wonder if what she's even thinking about?" you wonder to yourself but you focus on your way up to your destination.

As your senses were correct, it REALLY did took you a few minutes to the top. You take a peak inside and saw several pieces of breads and vegetables. You were hungry so you need to eat something.

Suddenly, the giant elf stood up back to her feet and picked her bag up, causing you to drop inside. You landed on top of a bread and looked up to see that she closed her bag, leaving you in the dark. You can feel the entire bag sway back and fourth a little as she strolled across the path. Looking down, you took a piece of the giant bread you are standing on and ate it. After that, you continue to eat until you were finally full.

You were getting awfully tired after climbing this pack as you started yawning. You hope that nothing happens while you take a rest inside here. Laying down, you closed your eyes and soon, you were asleep.
1153222112.title: A ride to the village

11532221121.content:
After a short break sitting on the grass to catch her breath from all that walking, Eliza got up and makes her way back to the village. The sack she was carry was sure pretty heavy due to all the food she bought from the store at a nearby village. The farm at her village has some veggies as well but unfortunately, they were only a few left and not all of them have fully grown yet so she has to go out and buy some somewhere. "I hope Len and Bonnie aren't both bothering mom back at home." She said as she was referring to her younger brother and sister; they can be quite troublesome especially to her mother.

A few minutes later, she arrives to the entrance of her village which was located within a small forest.

----------------------------------------------------------------

You woke up from your rest and got up from the ground. You don't know how long you were sleeping but you can still tell that you were still safe inside the sack. However, you don't feel any moment around here so you guess that the elf woman set the bag somewhere else. Outside, you can hear some voices but that didn't gave you any slightest clue at where you are right now.

Where were you right now?
11532221121.title: Eliza The Elf

115323.content:
You were surrounded by very tall grass which to be honest, it made you nervous because of how all of this made you feel like an insect at this moment. As if life reads your thoughts, a butterfly flew pass you and it wasn't the same one you know back in your home world. Instead of being smaller than you, it was larger than you! You really are the size of an insect here and possibly even smaller too!

Now that you know the truth behind your size, you don't where you are at the moment. You climb one of the grass blades in order to get a close look at this new world. Once you got to the top, you finally got a first look at the giant world.

You were on an open field that stretched for miles; the only thing you saw here at the moment were a few trees and small hills but no giants around here. You sighed a relief at the last part since you don't want to get stepped on right now, but you do need some help right now so you began searching for a sign of people around here.

For a while, you managed to find something that was a bit closer to you. It was a large area that was fenced up, but you could make out some structure behind the fences. The buildings appear to look like barns plus a farmhouse making you believe that it was a giant farm. It could have some people there that might help you out, but they might be too busy to find you.

You look and saw a nearby forest which is unlikely to have inhabitants, but you were kinda curious on what to find there and what this world's about.

While searching around some more, you suddenly stop at something further away. You can't make out what it is, but you can see a bright light coming from that spot. There was something going on there and you were on the urge to find out what it is. As attempting you are, it could be dangerous because you scent a rather unusual activity there.

Where would you go?
115323.title: The Vast Landscape

choices: Focus your efforts on finding a person to help.
Focus your efforts on finding somewhere to sleep on the farm.
1153231.content:
Buildings meant civilization. Civilization meant people. People could help.

And so you inched back down the blade of grass, keeping a mental note of the farm's direction. The journey ahead was akin to a long hike, unfortunately you had very little experience with even the basics of hiking, but it wasn't like you could leave to learn and come back later. Your knowledge of survival skills was limited as well, but it was quite easy to tell that anything lurking among the grass would be a threat. That and once night fell, your clothes would do little to protect from the cold.

With this rather damning information in hand, you pushed on regardless. Moving through clumpy dirt and towering grass, you pondered over how good this'd be for your fitness, perhaps that gym membership was a waste of money. Then again, there was no way for you to predict strange basement crystals.

Hours of walking passed, and your enthusiasm for the task ahead had been snuffed out like a candle in the wind. You didn't even know if you were heading in the right direction. That was until you saw it, a huge wooden pole stretching incomprehensibly high into the sky, and another, and another. The fence! You'd made it!

Even better, the sun was still high in the sky, there was quite some time left before nightfall. Now all that was left was to either find shelter or find someone to help.
1153231.title: To the Farm

choices: A shape rising above the corn plants, a young farmhand tending to the fields.
11532311.content:
Finding some crevice to crawl into could wait, in order to get home you'd need help, everything here was utterly enormous after all. You proceeded under the fence and into the farm.

The grass continued for a short while, before breaking away. Beyond was valleys of brown earth, much more visible than the ground was among the grass. The tree like grass was gone, replaced with even taller plants. You couldn't see the top of them, but they very much looked like corn plants. This world seemed familiar... but at the same time utterly foreign. It was the scale of the place you were sure, but it felt like there might've been something else about it. Something in the air, something odd.

You continued through the behemoth of a field, keeping a steady pace. It was easier to traverse than the open meadow, mostly thanks to how the plants were all in lines. The surroundings were quiet, leading to quite a relaxed stroll. The towering crops shielded you from the wind and there didn't seem to be many animals or creatures nearby.

The journey was all in all safe and calm, you figured that you could get used to this. That was until you heard something, something nearby. Looking around, your eyes landed upon:
11532311.title: A Bug in Goldenhill Farm

choices: Run towards the girl and try to climb her, being on the ground was dangerous.
Forget this! Scramble as far away from Faith as possible.
115323111.content:
Your eyes went wide, filled with unshakable awe as this monstrous figure filled your vision. Two large boots stood before you, even their treads rising higher off the dirt than you did. Hanging over the boots was what looked like a plain dress, made from some form of brownish fabric. With enough focus, you thought you could even see the spaces between the threads of it.

-------------------------------------

High above you and your concerns was a young girl, tending to her parent's field. The plants weren't too far along yet, which made it quite easy for her to walk among them and give them the water they needed to persist through the dry season. Faith was fifteen, a rather meek little thing (at least in comparison to other people native to this world). She was a tiefling, with red skin and solid purple eyes.

Horns sprouted from her head and a large thick tail extended from her rear. By almost all metrics, she looked quite demonic, and was immensely imposing to the tiny person before her. In her hands she held a crude watering can, it's heft and weight was clearly causing her some difficulty. Faith inched forwards slightly, pouring some water down onto the next couple of plants.

-------------------------------------

Your awe rather quickly turned to horror as the sky over you darkened, this person's immense shadow falling over you. It hit you how utterly gargantuan she was, your body filling with adrenaline. It only worsened as you spotted something seemingly falling, a couple of seconds passing before the first of the rainfalls began.

Water droplets crashed against the ground in great number, some of it soaking into the ground, with some of it sliding down across the dirt, some into the valley where you stood. This being was bringing water in magnitudes beyond anything you'd ever seen before, and in all honesty it was terrifying.

But staying still and gawking would only get you killed, you knew you had to do something.
115323111.title: Towering Tiefling

11533.content:
World 9

Inside a dark alter world located inside the center of earth known as Netherworld or to most people, Hell, is where foul demons, evil creatures, and bad souls go there for the rest of eternity...However, looks can be deceiving to the people from above...Inside the fiery pits of Hell, there is a gigantic and bustling high tech city that is larger than other big cities where many humanoid demons resides, doing what most humans do everyday except for two thing: All the demons are female and giant size with no sight of any male demons and the second one is Hell is under control by a kind yet powerful dark goddess and her 16 female legions. You must avoid being stepped on by the skyscraper size demonesses and try your best to get noticed by either the residents, the legions, or the dark goddess herself...
11533.title: World 9

choices: ...the head of a giant, punk-rock demon
...the stomach of a giant, sunbathing demon
...the foot of a giant, sandal-wearing, co-ed demon
115331.content:
After a long battle against that monstrous sphere, you immediately got yourself sucked right in! With your eyes shut, you felt the speed blow across your body as the force pushes you inside.

After a long trip, you felt the forces stop. You try to gather your strength and get up after you been weaken by such force. You opened your eyes slowly, but your vision was blurred. You rubbed them several times and looked at where you are.

You gasped when you saw where you are; it was red. No really, it was nothing but red all around you. The landscape seemed very odd as the ground was dark red in color; almost like the color of crimson blood. That wasn't the only thing you noticed something strange about it, you felt the ground to be...well kind of soft.....and even fleshy. Speaking of which, the ground have many strange patterns like you were on the middle of a desert or something. The land also has some strange, tree-like, things on some parts. "Where...Where am I?!" you said in sheer confusion.

Little did you know that you are almost micro-sized and on top of...
115331.title: Welcome to hell!

1153312.content:
At first, you were utterly confused as to where the hell you ended up. The ground was dark red and fleshy...and you could even hear a deep gurgle from the other side of the surface. As it turned out, you were atop the bare stomach of a sunbathing, bikini-clad demoness!

Fortunately, the demoness’s eyes were closed as she soaked in the sunlight...or whatever was giving off heat in the bowels of hell. You carefully tiptoed in hopes of getting away from potential danger, but another rumble threw you off-balance, causing you to stumble onto the belly, close to the demoness’s navel. Her eyes quickly opened and glanced down at a tiny figure on her stomach, which she quickly snatched with a dainty hand and moved toward her face.

“Well, well...” the demoness began to speak...
1153312.title: Sunbathing Demoness

choices: "You'll be part of it now!" Bezella eats you
"You'll be helping its tan!" Bezella makes you rub tan lotion on her
11533122.content:
"...Did you enjoy my belly?"

From the demoness' effortless but inescapable grip, you struggled to breathe. Her smug face glared down your flea-sized body, pushing it tight between the ridges of her gigantic index and thumb. How could she even see you - when her body was like a landscape in its own right, her boobs below forming mountain ranges? You felt absolutely engulfed by her satellite-sized lime irises, pitch-black pupils showing a slight slant. The lashes caused gusts as they blinked towards you.

You repeated, confused: "E-enjoy your..." It was hard to read her tone when her mouth wasn't even in your field of view, stretching far down below. Was that a look of excitement, or anger?

"Don't think I didn't see you on my gut, pesky mortal!" The demon girl laughed, dangling you before her flying spittle. From this dizzying position, you saw a flash of her teal hair, hanging loose, lathered with beads of sweat from the dimension's sweltering temperature. Wide horns rose from within the locks, sharp and well-polished. "I don't know where you came from, little one - but you're on Feliss Beach now, at the heart of the Netherworld. Here, nobody can go around feeling people's skin..." Her dainty digits rubbed her gut, right where you were, the pointed fingernails easily running across the malleable skin. "Especially not a tiny bug like you! The only male anywhere in this world - I can have you boiled in the second hell for your insolent lust, facing the dark goddess' legion of the damned!"

Despite the intense sensation of burning, you felt frozen and numb. "I...I didn't..." This towering woman's fingers, despite their constricting, inescapable hold on your chest, felt loose with carelessness. The bounders of sand built up around them, along with the dripping sweat, threatened to sweep you away and send you rocketing back down. The Netherworld? That strange flash had transported you right into hell! You could only imagine the great rocks and people laboring in torture.

But it was entirely different. From up here, you finally got a good view of the surrounding area: a beach... entirely populated by gigantic demon girls! No males or humans in sight, just building-sized ladies loafing and relaxing around the whole sandy country! Some, like your captor, are soaking in the sun, resting on towels and chairs - this giantess' towel had a pattern of skulls across it, exactly like one in the modern world above. Sandals crashed around, lifting sandstorms of boulders with their treads - completely unnoticeable to them. Most terrifyingly, some wet bodies frolicked, dove, and paddled in a red sea... an ocean of boiling lava, so hot that steam rose from the waves!

Was this where you were going to die? You clasped your hands together, made cross symbols over yourself, and whimpered, desperate for some miracle to save you from this temptress of the Netherworld's shores...

"Haha, look at you wriggle!" She snickered, her sharp teeth in a smile. "I lied to you. What fun would it be to just watch another stupid sinner burn up? You're in luck; the great Bezella has decided to give this belly button lint some mercy..." She brushed her azure hair back, the ends snapping like whips in the distance. "...As long as he pays her back justly for your insolence. So, I ask again: did you enjoy my belly, specky? You can have much more of it..." She rubbed the flesh once more, blood-red canyons and salty rivers rising and falling.

Bezella... You shivered before her mighty form, and considered her offer. Make a deal with a devil? That sounded terrifying.
